messages.subject: Yahoo or mommy brain
messages.msgSnippet: It may be Yahoo since my email address is listed; none of the included text came from me.  Perhaps your email software is burping. Kris
messages.messageBody:
It may be Yahoo since my email address is listed; none of the included
text came from me. Perhaps your email software is burping.

Kris

***************************

Is it Yahoo or mommy brain? Didn't this come through about a week ago
complete with this answer?

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: <PSoroosh@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, April 19, 2002 6:35 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Not an unschooler =)


> In a message dated 4/19/2002 11:14:04 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
> louisam1@... writes:
>
>
> > <let them, but I don't buy it. I grew up with very limited TV
> > watching, and (as a result, I believe) I don't watch much TV now.
> > Virtually all the folks I know who don't watch TV as adults grew up
> > without TVs or with very limited TV watching. Sure, kids clamor for
> > forbidden fruit, but they also fill their lives up with other
> > interesting things and forget that the TV is even there.>>
>
> My dh grew up with no electricity at all. He never saw a tv until he
was
an
> older teenager.
>
> He LOVES it -- he still has the same sense of it being VERY COOL and
amazing.
>
> We got a tv when I was 4 or 5 -- we watched a lot, I think. My mom says
she
> limited it but I sure remember watching it!!! There are shows I like --
but I
> don't watch a whole lot. I'm pretty selective about what I'll spend my
time
> on -- I have too many other things to do - like participate in email
> discussions <G>. My 17 yo has had unlimited tv and she watches almost
none --
> only an occasional episode of the the Simpsons. My 14 yo has always had
> unlimited tv and she watches almost none - she does watch videos of
operas
> and musicals. My 11 yo has always had unlimited tv and she watches
slightly
> more than the other girls - but is, like me, pretty selective about
what
she
> watches. My husband, who had no tv as a kid, watches more than the rest
of
us
> put together, for sure.
>
> --pamS
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
